comment.text:
Love this place! We shared small plates, and the sweet potatoes are to die for! Cute atmosphere, great service, lots of gluten free options, reasonable prices, and free parking. What more can you ask for?

This is in the rotation as a "go to" place for a dinner out!

photos.caption: Sweet potatoes, lamb skewers, Buffalo cauliflower

comment.text:
Poor Hendrix is a really nice spot for a late night bite to eat. You can get anything from classic Buffalo wings, or something totally different like trout skins and spicy peanut cold noodles.

Can't go wrong with either! Definitely will be coming back for more in the near future.

Also, the service here is always friendly and attentive. Not to mention, the whole place has a cozy vibe to it in general. Feels like a nice place to just unwind after a long day, and have a bite of amazing food. You don't even need to drink, either. I come in just for the food!

When we got there, the place was packed, but we were able to grab an outside table pretty quickly. We then waited about 30m before anyone served us. When they got to us, we were given a couple shots of whiskey on the house for our wait, and they said our beers we ordered with dinner were also on them. Much appreciated and they were fairly speedy getting food out to us. 

Food was great, the fish and chips was delicious. 

We also ordered a couple beers after food, and they comped those as well, leaving us very happy with their thoughtfulness and generosity in spite of the wait. 

The location is great, the outside patio had a great vibe and they kicked on the heaters as it dipped a little cooler. Great spot, highly recommend.

An Open Letter To The Owners: 

This email could not wait. I stopped into your establishment tonight and I can't say enough how much my cousin and I enjoyed ourselves. From the atmosphere, to the food, to the service. Bravo. 

We walked away talking about the food and even making a point to note that we must come back tomorrow for dessert and a drink to celebrate my cousins birthday. That grilled cheese is not just any old grilled cheese but an elevated experience, maybe a little dramatic but maybe even tear inducing. 

I walked away noting that this was comfort food done well and I felt comfortable and welcome. Brandon was a gem and he was extremely attentive. 

I don't normally give 5 star reviews because well it my first visit and I like to go a second time to make sure it wasn't a fluke. You DESERVE .

photos.caption: Fish and chips - cornmeal batter makes this
Grilled Cheese aka An experience. Eat immediately!!!

comment.text: Food, drinks and service are always amazing I love the vegan options parking is really close and convenient I love the atmosphere and music

photos.caption: Grilled cheese on sourdough and and tomato bisque
Smoked trout dip and grilled carrots

comment.text: Fantastic food, cocktails and house-made sauces in a place with a great vibe. Not overpriced, either. Our go-to spot in East Lake!

The food was so yummy. I feel like this is a great location to end the night. Grab a desert and a cocktail! You won't be disappointed. Service is ok. Nothing to write home about but nothing to complain about either. It's a beautiful location. I can't wait to go back.

Our favorite neighborhood place! Always top-notch menu, great atmosphere, good service! We've been going to this place regularly for 2 years now, and most of the staff is still the same, which to me means that they are doing something right and treat their employees well!

While visiting Atlanta we came across this neighborhood bar and eatery. We sat at the bar next to some regulars who guided us through the menu. The bar tenders were very attentive and helpful. We ordered a couple allagash white beers. I have to say that as a white ale lover it was one of the best beers I've had. We ordered the grilled cheese w/ tomato soup bisque, shrimp skewers, lamb skewers, mushroom skewers, and the sticky sesame wings. All was great. I especially liked the shrimp skewers that had the perfect amount of flavorful spice. We enjoyed our food so much we ended up ordering a fudgy pecan cookie. Wow! That cookie was the bomb! The filling of ganache was light and flavorful. I would definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Grilled cheese w/ tomato soup bisque

comment.text: I love this restaurant!  The menu is creative and in tune with the season. There's always something to find - whether vegetarian or not. They work with me if I need to edit something out. And the servers are super chill and make me feel so taken care of.  You should definitely check it out!

It's not enough in this town to have a great bar anymore, the kitchen has to be great too. PH is a smallish, walk-in only spot in Eastlake at the corner of Hosea Williams and Second. It's a good location because you're all like "Let's go to Oakhurst" and then it's all like "look at all this cool stuff before Oakhurst" and then before long you're stuffing your face at PH.

Wife and I went on a date night, relying on the restaurant's current rep for serving American bistro-style small plates. We both had a bourbon mint punch (kind of Julepy) that was sweet enough to cut through the major hit of savory brought by our munchies, which were served adeptly and kitchen-hot. Got the shrimp skewers (great seasoning on these), lamb skewers, cold Asian noodles (spicy), buffalo cauliflower (good texture), and another shrimp skewer for good luck. All great quality stuff.

We sat on the patio which was pretty laid back and peaceful. The bar seats were packed inside, so I am led to believe that the real experience of PH is at those bar seats. We'll try for that next time and further explore the menu. Finally, the meal was actually a pretty good value. Multiple high quality small plates, two cocktails, and tip for less than 60 bucks. Can't beat that these days.

Lamb Skewers. Don't ask questions... Just order them. They're amazing! And the grinder was a solid choice too. The fries were crispy on the outside with yummy seasoning and soft on the inside, just how I like them. The parking can be found behind the building and then you can walk right up on the back patio. Dining is a little close quarters inside but plenty of room and heaters for outdoor seating. The only complaint I have is the portion for pricing (as the name was a bit deceiving, or perhaps it's right on point)... but it IS some quality food if you're ready to spend a little money!

photos.caption: This grinder was legit! And those fries!

comment.text:
Poor Hendrix is delightful! The food and drinks are great - as someone who avoids alcohol, I'm a big fan of the fact they stock non-alcoholic beer. And my wife loves the cocktail selection. The food is always tasty and creative.

More importantly, the staff are all great, and the atmosphere is perfect. Poor Hendrix is a new discovery for us, and I'm so glad we found it!

Do NOT come with kids! 

There are no kids allowed on patio and the inside seating is very limited. 

I get this maybe after 9 or 10 pm if it becomes a wild bar scene, but this place seems too chill to have a rule like this. My kid is 12 and is in no way a disruption, but we can't come here because of this rule. I've never heard of anything like this- even at really fancy restaurants. Such a huge fail for the owner who clearly  doesn't have kids.

This was a cool spot in a neighborhood we've never been to before. We didn't have any trouble finding parking or a table outside around 8 pm on a Saturday night. It was a bit cloudy/rainy that day so I could see how this place would fill up when the weather is better. The patio is covered and there are fans for the summer months. For drinks, we had the bourbon tea punch and an oopsie daisy. We ordered drinks at the same time that we ordered food. Our server was attentive without being too pushy. Everything came out around the same time and we could tell the drinks had been sitting around based on the condensation on the  glasses. Both were a little on the sweet side and didn't taste particularly strong, but were still good especially for the price. The fish and chips was interesting because it was fried fish nuggets as opposed to a larger filet. The real standout for me was the Italian grinder on focaccia sandwich. Wow! This was so well crafted and with the softest bread, and was just the right amount of spice. I would come back again and again just to eat that sandwich, and I'm not a huge sandwich person, especially when I go out for dinner. 

I also love the story behind this place - named after a rescue pit bull!

This is the BEST neighborhood bar/restaurant/hang out you could ever wish for. Except the food is 10x better than that of your typical neighborhood hang out and the wait staff is just as good. Not to mention affordable, good music and....did I mention the food? 

MUST TRY...and try and try again.
Great appetizers top shelf drinks in cool atmosphere I will definitely go again excellent for date night

My dog and I dined on the heated porch, which was wonderful that they're dog-friendly.
The wait staff was very attentive to both me and Big Baby. They brought her a water-bowl and gave her a treat.
I had the rainbow trout with lentils, and it was the best piece of fish I've ever eaten (and that includes trout fresh out of a Maine lake on the Appalachian Trail!).
I paired it with a Left Handed "Death Before Disco" Porter that was smooth and chocolaty.
Can't wait to go back and try some of their other offerings. Highly recommended.
The food was not worth the the price. It's typical bar food, nothing special. The drinks we ordered were pretty good though! Parking fills up fast in the lot.

Food was good. The waitress was attentive but when I ask what her favorite she said she doesn't eat here Hmmm... ok Anyways I ordered  Indian chicken burger and smashed sweet potatoes . The drinks were also good. They didn't skimp on the alcohol it was nice and balanced. It was a bourbon sour. The ambiance was laid back and other customers were very friendly as the seating on the patio was close.

Absolutely love this place!  The food and ambience is always reliable and top tier. The staff is wonderfully attentive and service is always quick and accurate. Poor Hendrix is a stress free, feel good spot that never ever disappoints!

Everything about this place was so good!  Excellent service from the minute we sat down.  We ordered the tapas.  Hands down, the spiced mushrooms were the most amazing.  However, close second was the sweet potatoes.  We also got the lamb and shrimp skewers and sticky sesame wings.  The lamb was very tender.  Everything was full of flavor.  And the drinks were good too!

Yesterday was my birthday and we were in the area to go to St Mountain Park and we picked the restaurant strictly from the yelp reviews and we were not disappointed!  

The food was phenomenal the back patio was perfect to allow the dogs.  It's covered and has lots of fans so it was very comfortable.  Everyone was so sweet and our waiter was Walter and he was GREAT!   A sweet waitress that I didn't get her name brought homemade peanut butter cookie treats for the dogs.

The party peach cider was THE BOMB!

Helpful hint, order the bread for the mussels to soak up the yummy wine garlic sauce and the crème brûlée of the day was lemon basil and was phenomenal.   We will be back!  Lake Sinclair, Ga

photos.caption: Mussels...order bread with them to soak up the garlic wine sauce!
Back patio allowed the dogs and was very comfortable with the shade covering and lots of fans

comment.text: So great in so many ways.  Love that it is laid back but some of the best food you will taste.  All the servers we have had have been delightful!  Everything is quick too!  Kudos!
We dropped in from a rainy night in the Atlanta area. I am happy we did. Great food and the ambiance is perfect for a date or a girl's night out.

Poor Hendrix has just become one of my favorite bars in Atlanta. The drinks are good & strong. The appetizers are delicious and reasonably priced. I fell in love with all the food that graced my tongue.
What I loved most, besides the food, is that the bartenders are real bartenders. My guy was able to pair my drinks with my appetizers. I asked him to fix me a drink that paired well with the watermelon salad (which was OMG Good, btw) and he made the best Hendricks Martini I ever had. The other appetizers I tried include the Cold Noodles, Baked Okra (no listed on the menu) and the Rice Krispy treat. 
At this time the dinning tables are seated outside on the back patio. In door seating is located at the bar.
Poor Hendrix is hidden gem.  It has great ambience and even better food.
We really enjoyed everything about Hendrix.  Ate on the patio. Very pleasant.  The Buffalo cauliflower is killer.  The staff was terrific fun.
Awesome food, great drinks, kind staff. Came for my birthday with friends and really enjoyed all our meals and drinks. The Indian fried chicken sandwich is phenomenal
Great food!  Great people and fun atmosphere.  Love that it's in the neighborhood.  You won't be disappointed.
Love Poor Hendrix! Everything on the menu is spectacular, staff are super friendly, atmosphere is great

Close your eyes and imagine if a 5-star chef made a casual dinner for their family and friends for dinner party. That's what this experience is like - it's a very premium dining experience in the most understated and unorthodox way.

THIS place is an entire vibe!! The music is ALWAYS on point. . The food is excellent!  And the customer service is comforting. Residing in the area. . This is our local, "Cheers", which I definitely recommend to ALL. There's indoor and outdoor seating. Nothing stuffy. . Just good food and company.
This is one of our favorite places.  Great food, amazing staff, great drinks.  See Walter on the patio, he'll take care of you!  Neighborhood vibes.  Love it.
Poor Hendrix is an excellent restaurant.  We had excellent timely service and the food was amazing.  The sweet potato biscuits are to die for!
Amazing service and food. Come with an open mind and appetite. Everything was amazing. Try whatever they have that is seasonal or a special. Ask for Kyrr, she's amazing :-)

Incredible food, incredible people, incredible service, incredible ambiance!  It's the place I want to go to relax after a long day, and it is the place I always bring out of towners. The area is very lucky to have such a gem in our neighborhood!

I've been meaning to come back to this place after having been once a year prior. I was finally able to come back this past weekend and I brought along my family who were in town visiting. My family and I absolutely loved our experience. The staff was so friendly and nice, and the food was amazing! The service was beyond amazing - our server even whipped up a dipping sauce my mom mentioned liking! Needless to say I will certainly be coming back again, and much sooner than last time!

We enjoy the atmosphere and service of this place. It's one of the closest restaurants to us, and honestly we'd be regulars and come weekly IF ONLY the menu was just a little bit bigger.

We're both dairy free, and there never seems to be enough options for us. We are happy to see they have started marking DF on items that are dairy free!

If we're just going for a bowl of fries and drinks, this place is great. Would just really love to have a salad or meat dinner option consistently. 

Prices are better than most of the other places in the area too. So that's another plus.

Decided to go yesterday to celebrate Father's Day. Small shared parking area with like three other restaurants and in the middle of a neighborhood. I was already annoyed trying to find a spot. Got in and no space on the patio. So we headed inside and found some tables on the other side of the bar. After that everything was fantastic, service was awesome, these guys are quick to help. Food, which is a lot of small plates that are kinda elevated, was absolutely on point and quick to table. I had skewered mushrooms (seasoned and charred perfectly) and the buffalo cauliflower (not the least bit wilted but at the same time cooked enough so they aren't hard). My wife had the wings with a chili sauce (bangin'), steak skewers (lil pricey for the amount of meat but still really tasty) and a basket of fries. And all this stuff was on it. They have great cocktails too. Highly recommend the Rose Gold Hoops. Even the dessert (the owner is a pastry chef btw) is on point, we got to try out the brown butter rice crispy treat which had just the right amount of brown butter taste without being obnoxious. This is definitely a five star place, plan on coming again soon.

Do not come here with kids. You will be a second-class diner. Families with children are seated in the parking lot, receive no service and are summoned with a megaphone to get their food. On our visit, we were the only family in the lot, yet the host still felt the need to use the megaphone to alert us our food was ready. I totally get it. People do need quiet spaces without young children. So just state clearly that children aren't allowed. Don't tell me there's a "backyard" where I can sit with my family. There's a parking lot below the main diners where you will eat and drink in paper vessels and be shouted at to pick up your food.

My new favorite hangout! The food is really good and the place has a wonderful, friendly, chill vibe.

Come as you are and have some crispy Brussels sprouts, a cocktail or whatever, and guilty pleasure, I love their chicken nuggets.

They closed between Christmas and NY because of the Omicron surge, but they will be back! Before the holidays, they were fairly busy but it felt safe.

Servers are masked and there is good distancing while still feeling welcoming and comfortable.

Always solid. Constantly changing menu. Never had a bad experience. It is first come first serve with seating so be prepared to get there early, sit at the bar, or wait for something to open up.  Everything I've ever gotten has been great.

Im not sure how Ive never heard of this place prior, but Im so glad we found it and decided to stop in! The perfect patio for dogs. Great food at great price points! Rotational menu with quality, in-season ingredients. This will be our new spot!
Delicious fusion cuisine in a quaint atmosphere with a wonderful staff! My friends and I love coming here.

One of my favorite places to come get a meal and a drink! I dream about this restaurant's amazing grilled cheese. The servers are super friendly and the staff and bartenders are awesome. Drinks are strong and the menu options are delicious. Definitely add this into your rotation!

Another great evening here... the patio is just perfect in the summer. Enjoyed a few interesting cocktails and continued my love affair with the peanut noodles. We also had the hamachi, the mushrooms (seriously you need to order more than one order. We always do..) and deviled eggs (yum) and broccoli fritters (these are particularly impressive - something divine in the texture, and you can pretend you're getting a serving of veggies like a grown up.) 

Finish with the brown butter rice crispy treat.

photos.caption: Mushrooms, fries, broccoli fritters, noodles, hamachi.

comment.text: Great food and service! The lamb skewers are dope and you must try the buffalo cauliflower. I will be bringing friends there again and again.

This was an awesome dining experience!  To me, this place would be considered fancy and a place I wouldn't normally go to in Southern California, but the fact that the portions and the prices are so reasonable really surprised me! 

Everything we got was amazing and I would have wanted to order more!  If you go, you won't be disappointed ordering what we ordered.  Pictured (attached to the review) are the Rigatoni with Roasted Chicken and Shitakes, Grilled Cheese Sandwich, Chicken Liver Pate Toast, Dry-Rubbed Shrimp Skewers, Moroccan Lamb Skewers, Garlicky White Bean Dip, House-Made Ricotta and Salted Brown Butter Rice Crispy Treats.

This was such an awesome find!  I loved everything about this place, from the ambiance, to the restrooms, to the friendly service!  It was so worth the visit!

photos.caption: Salted Brown Butter Rice Crispy Treats

comment.text: The service was exceptional, the vegan options were absolutely delicious, and the patio was beautiful. Will be coming back. Thanks for your awesome service and amazing food (our server wore glasses and was super awesome).
